recipes.php5::default: Performs the installation of php5, pear, the php5 module for apache, and the smarty template library.  Additional modules can be specified at runtime

php5/module_list.description: A list of PHP5 modules to install, separated by spaces. Only supply the module name appearing after php5-.  For instance if you wanted php5-mysql and php5-imap installed, this list should be set to "mysql imap".  To view a full list of available php5 modules see the Ubuntu package page http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?searchon=names&keywords=php5-

php5/server_usage.description:
* dedicated (where the php-fpm config file allocates all existing resources of the machine)
* shared (where the php-fpm config file is configured to use less resources so that it can be run concurrently with other apps like MySQL for example)

name: php5
long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:
Installs Zend Framework 1.11.1 and makes it available to apache and/or the CLI.

Also provides some tools for deploying zend framework applications using other Chef repos and cookbooks.

Why not simply install the libzend-framework-php package? Because even on Ubuntu 10.10 it's not the latest version, and
it doesn't add the zend library to php's include_path.  Believe me, I'd rather use a more standard method to install.

= REQUIREMENTS:
Ubuntu

= ATTRIBUTES:

= USAGE:
